    • Method Detail

      • readSingleBlock

        public byte[] readSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress)
                       throws STException
        Read Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Reads the content of one memory block (command code 0x20). Uses the default flag that was set in TagCommand.setFlag(). Uses the default uid that was set in TagCommand.setUid().
        Specified by:
        readSingleBlock in interface VicinityCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - 2-byte address of the block to read
        Returns:
        array of bytes = 1 byte response flag + the content of the block
        Throws:
        STException

      • readSingleBlock

        public byte[] readSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                              byte flag,
                              byte[] uid)
                       throws STException
        Read Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Reads the content of one memory block (command code 0x20).
        Specified by:
        readSingleBlock in interface VicinityCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - 2-byte address of the block to read (LSByte first)
        flag - Request flag for the command. The protocol extension flag should be set to 1.
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        array of bytes = 1 byte response flag + the content of the block
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeSingleBlock

        public byte writeSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                             byte[] buffer)
                      throws STException
        Write Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Updates the content of one memory block (command code 0x21). Uses the default flag that was set in TagCommand.setFlag(). Uses the default uid that was set in TagCommand.setUid().
        Specified by:
        writeSingleBlock in interface VicinityCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - 2-byte address of the block to write
        buffer - Data to write
        Returns:
        1 byte response for status
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeSingleBlock

        public byte writeSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                             byte[] buffer,
                             byte flag,
                             byte[] uid)
                      throws STException
        Write Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Updates the content of one memory block (command code 0x21).
        Specified by:
        writeSingleBlock in interface VicinityCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - 2-byte address of the block to write (LSByte first)
        buffer - Data to write
        flag - Request flag for the command. The protocol extension flag should be set to 1.
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte response for status
        Throws:
        STException

      • readMultipleBlock

        public byte[] readMultipleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                                byte nbrOfBlocks)
                         throws STException
        Read Multiple Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Read the content of one or more memory blocks (command code 0x23). Uses the default flag that was set in TagCommand.setFlag(). Uses the default uid that was set in TagCommand.setUid().
        Specified by:
        readMultipleBlock in interface VicinityCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - 2-byte address of the first block to read
        Returns:
        array of bytes = 1 byte response flag + the content of the selected block
        Throws:
        STException

      • readMultipleBlock

        public byte[] readMultipleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                                byte nbrOfBlocks,
                                byte flag,
                                byte[] uid)
                         throws STException
        Read Multiple Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Read the content of one or more memory blocks (command code 0x23).
        Specified by:
        readMultipleBlock in interface VicinityCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - 2-byte address of the first block to read (LSByte first)
        nbrOfBlocks - The number of blocks in the request is one less than the number of blocks that the VICC shall return in its response.
        flag - Request flag for the command. The protocol extension flag should be set to 1.
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        array of bytes = 1 byte response flag + the content of the selected block
        Throws:
        STException

      • fastReadSingleBlock

        public byte[] fastReadSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress)
                           throws STException
        Custom Fast Read Single Block command. Reads the content of one memory block (command code 0xC0). Uses the default flag that was set in TagCommand.setFlag(). Uses the default uid that was set in TagCommand.setUid().
        Specified by:
        fastReadSingleBlock in interface VicinityCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - 2-byte address of the block to read
        Returns:
        array of bytes = 1 byte response flag + the content of the block
        Throws:
        STException

      • fastReadMultipleBlock

        public byte[] fastReadMultipleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                                    byte nbrOfBlocks,
                                    byte flag,
                                    byte[] uid)
                             throws STException
        Custom Fast Read Multiple Block command. Read the content of one or more memory blocks (command code 0x23).
        Specified by:
        fastReadMultipleBlock in interface VicinityCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - 2-byte address of the first block to read (LSByte first)
        nbrOfBlocks - The number of blocks in the request is one less than the number of blocks that the VICC shall return in its response.
        flag - Request flag for the command. The protocol extension flag should be set to 1.
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        array of bytes = 1 byte response flag + the content of the selected block
        Throws:
        STException
